words.definition: An altar is a table used in churches.
words.example: The altar had many lit candles on it.

words.definition: Arthritis is an illness causing pain and swelling in a person’s joints.
words.example: Agatha couldn’t play the piano anymore because of her arthritis.

words.definition: Botany is the study of plants.
words.example: Gardens are the best places for botany.

words.definition: If something or someone is credible, they can be believed or trusted.
words.example: Dick gave a credible reason for being late and didn’t get in any trouble.

words.definition: If someone is deceased, they are dead.
words.example: The property was left to him by a deceased relative.

words.definition: Deception is the act of lying or tricking someone.
words.example: The magician’s trick was a clever deception.

words.definition: To decipher means to figure out the meaning of something difficult to read.
words.example: The archeologist deciphered the ancient writing.

words.definition: Dung is the waste of animals.
words.example: Farmers use dung to help their plants grow.

words.definition: Dusk is the time of day when it is becoming dark.
words.example: The children went home at dusk.

words.definition: To gratify means to please someone.
words.example: It gratified her to see her students succeed.

words.definition: To hone something is to make it better or sharper.
words.example: He honed his skills by practicing every day.

words.definition: To mash something is to crush it into a soft mass.
words.example: She mashed the potatoes with a fork.

words.definition: If something is ornate, it is decorated with a lot of detail.
words.example: The mirror had an ornate silver frame.

words.definition: Pneumonia is a serious illness of the lungs.
words.example: The old man was hospitalized with pneumonia.

words.definition: If someone is psychic, they can see the future or read minds.
words.example: The psychic predicted that he would win the lottery.

words.definition: If someone is psychotic, they have a serious mental illness.
words.example: The murderer was found to be psychotic.

words.definition: The scope of something is the area it covers.
words.example: The scope of the investigation was very wide.

words.definition: If something is sinister, it seems evil or dangerous.
words.example: The dark house looked very sinister.

words.definition: Strife is disagreement or fighting between people or groups.
words.example: The country was torn by internal strife.

words.definition: If something is therapeutic, it helps to cure an illness or relax.
words.example: A hot bath can be very therapeutic.
